page.title: 18Leisure&Recreation.
page.content: Facilities in the Kinross area are growing.Local fund-raising brought outdoor changing rooms at{King George {V Park. Derelict land}at the old rail station by the Scottish Development Agency has been{landscaped}as the Davies Park. Part of the old line southwards may be used as a walk. The {Kirkgate Park}road needs repair after many years as the route to a well used local amenity. The old East Church is now well used as a day{Church Centre throughout the week. Elderly and disabled people can now reach it by minibus. The old Millbridge Hall has been condemned and demolished. Plans are in hand for a new suite of halls, mainly for local youth organisations. Locals also hope for more use of school buildings and would like a new public{swimming pool}as the Green Hotel pool is small and overused.
